results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 05: Episodes 09-10
results.brief_description: As the century approaches its end, so do the lives of the more senior Forsytes. Jo’s wife, Helene, dies from a fall, before madness destroys her mind, and Jo himself begins to see more of Irene. Soames, meanwhile, desperate for an heir, wants a divorce from Irene and his sister, Winifred, seeks the same from her husband, after he elopes with a Spanish dancer. The lives of a new generation of Forsytes start to take shape, but the recurring conflicts of love and personal animosity carry their bittersweet legacies uncompromisingly towards the twentieth century.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 04: Episodes 12-14
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s epic saga continues… Despite Jo’s misgivings, his relationship with Irene blossoms, but their joy is marred by Jolly’s death out in South Africa. Soames has his evidence for a divorce, and a series of marriages, births and deaths continues to shape the destiny of the Forsyte family. The Great War shakes out the last vestiges of Victorian England, and among the younger Forsytes a new love burns, rekindling bitter old feuds. Oblivious to the enduring resentment harboured by their parents, Jon and Fleur meet by chance and fall in love. But the reluctance of Jo, Irene and Soames to reveal the truth of the past to their children makes tham all the more determined to discover it.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 04: Episodes 07-08
results.brief_description: Autumn arrives, and the fog swirls malevolently around the streets of London. Soames’ marriage to Irene reaches breaking point as he sues her lover, Bosinney, over the country house he has built for him. After Bosinney’s death, June persuades her grandfather, Jolyon to buy the house from Soames, and there he prepares to live out his days together with his family. But while Jo, Helene and June are in Spain, Jolyon has a visitor, who then becomes a regular guest and companion through that last, peaceful summer.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 03: Episodes 09-11
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s remarkable chronicles continue… as the twentieth century looms, the lives of the more senior Forsytes draw to a close. Jo’s wife, Helene, dies from a fall before madness can claim her, and Jo becomes closer to Irene. Soames, meanwhile, desperate for an heir, wants a divorce from Irene and his sister Winifred seeks the same from her husband, who has eloped with a Spanish dancer. The Boer War draws the younger Forsytes into its web as Jo’s son Jolly challenges the despised Val Dartie to join him in enlisting for the Imperial Yeomanry. June and Holly also volunteer as nurses, though each for different reasons. Finally, as the vengeful Soames sites his cousin Jo in the divorce proceedings against his wife, Jo and Irene come to realize the depth of their feeling for each other.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 03: Episodes 05-06
results.brief_description: While Queen Victoria prepares to celebrate her Golden Jubilee, the Forsytes’ fortunes continue to fluctuate. Ann, the eldest of the family, dies, and Jo’s appearance at her funeral marks a great improvement in relations with his father. Soames commissions June’s fiancee, Philip Bosinney to build a house outside London, though it becomes increasingly clear that Soames’ wife, Irene and the young architect are passionately in love. Gossip flies, and finally reaches Soames himself.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 02: Episodes 05-08
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s story continues… Jo is slowly welcomed back into the Forsyte fold as his father Jolyon’s stubborn resolve weakens. Soames has commisioned June’s fiance, Philip Bossiney, to build a house at Robin Hill, though it becomes increasingly clear that Soames wife, Irene and the young architect are passionately in love. Soames’ discovery of the affair leads to a brutal, frenzied climax. Soames, in spiteful revenge, sues Bossiney over his work at Robin Hill, but Bossiney does not live to defend himself. Jolyon moves into the country house to live out his days with his family. While Jo, Helene and June are in Spain, Jolyon is visited by Irene, who becomes a regular guest and companion through that last, peaceful summer.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 02: Episodes 03-04
results.brief_description: To the clatter of hansom cabs on London’s cobbled streets, the story of the Forsytes unfurls. Soames Forsyte persuades the beautiful but distant Irene to marry him, though on one rather strange condition, and from the start their marriage is totally devoid of warmth and communication. Jo is at last free to marry his mistress, Helene and his daughter, June, becomes engaged to a bohemian young architect who threatens to bring another strain of unpredictability to the Forsyte family, challenging its established preoccupations of money and property.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 01: Episodes 01-04
results.brief_description: This celebrated adaptation of John Galsworthy’s remarkable story begins in 1879. The talk in the Forsyte’s opulent drawing room revolves around Winifred’s marriage to “man of the world” Monty Dartie, and the scandal of Jo’s relationship with Helene, his daughter’s Austrian governess. Jo’s coldly calculating cousin Soames persuades the beautiful Irene Heron to marry him, but their marriage proves devoid of passion or communication. Meanwhile, the sudden death of Jo’s wife leaves him free to marry his mistress, though he is promptly cut off from the family’s wealth; and Jo’s estranged daughter June becomes engaged to a bohemian young architect who threatens to bring a new strain of unpredictability to the family.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 01: Episodes 01-02
results.brief_description: As the story begins it is 1879, and talk in the opulent drawing rooms of London’s upper-middle class society revolves around the Forsytes. Winifred’s marriage to the roguish Monty Dartie has the Forsyte aunts cooing, as do Jo’s extra-marital exploits with his daughter’s Austrian governess. Jo’s cousin, the coldly calculating Soames Forsyte, has meanwhile met Irene Heron, and the scene is set for a tempestuous future, where beauty clashes with possessiveness, and the results smoulder dangerously beneath the tinderbox of high Victorian morality and repressed passion.

results.title: The Forsyte saga (2002) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International, Sita Williams and Christopher Menaul
results.brief_description: Originally produced in 1967 by the BBC, John Galsworthy’s popular novel of life in early 20th century London as seen through the eyes of the Forsyte family is given a fresh injection of talent and production values in this 2002 Granada Television mini-series. Set in Victorian England, sex, corruption, greed and jealousy characterise the machinations and minutiae of two branches of the same family, headed by the patriarchs Jolyon (Corin Redgrave) and James (John Carlisle) Forsyte. Cast includes: Damian Lewis, Rupert Graves, Gina McKee, Corin Redgrave, Ioan Gruffudd. Written by Stephen Mallatratt.
